WESTPORT — An embattled State Road auto sales business has withdrawn its request for a name change.

F & R Auto Sales' name appeared on the selectmen's agenda on Monday but Chairman Craig Dutra said at Monday's meeting that the company has withdrawn that request.

F & R finance manager Robert Rogers on Tuesday confirmed the company has lost interest in pursuing the matter. Francis Correiro, the owner, could not be reached for comment.

Rogers said he is not aware of why Correiro reversed his decision on the name change.

According to paperwork at Town Hall, Correiro and F & R cited bad publicity as the reason why it wanted to change its name to King's Auto Inc., says Selectmen Vice Chairman R. Michael Sullivan.


Sullivan chaired the June 29 selectmen's meeting during which F & R Auto formally requested the name change. Sullivan said he requested F & R Auto to meet with selectmen at Monday's meeting. Instead, the company sent word of its decision to retain its name.

This comes during a difficult year for the company, which made national news for its treatment of a pizza delivery employee. Company representatives in January allegedly berated a Pizza Palace delivery man over an order and then one representative posted it online. Many rose to the defense of the pizza employee and not the auto business.
